Location: Slough, Berkshire, South East England, England
Description:
It matters to us that Team O2 is as diverse as the communities we serve.
We’re aware that we need more diversity in our senior leadership roles, so we welcome and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.
Whoever you are, O2 has a place for you.
Come join us.

Location(s): Slough

About the role

We are transforming our business by putting data driven insight at the heart of everything we do.

The BI & Performance measurement team, sitting in our Data, Insights & Analytics function, ensures we are measuring, monitoring and optimising the performance of our business against objectives and in the context of a very competitive marketplace.

We have c.20m customers and a wealth of structured and unstructured data including (but not limited to):


Transactions and billing,
Detailed customer call records (millions per day)
Usage of our loyalty programme (million per month)
Geographical data (millions of points per day)
Profitability of each customer
Network usage

You will have the opportunity of leading the econometrics delivery in our business, with one other team member working on some challenging and fascinating problems in a data rich environment.

The BI & Performance Measurement team is an important part of our newly defined Data & Analytics Strategy, driving data to the core of O2 to ensure right time insights to empower our leaders and our business to make better and quicker decisions.

About the role

The Analytics Manager is part of the Decision Support area of our BI & Measurement team. The role is required to have experience in some elements of the analysis, insight generation and measurement lifecycle, working with stakeholders to understand their business challenges and their KPIs to ensure the business intelligence we provide is truly actionable and drives value. In particular this role will focus on bringing what we know about the customer to the business via self-serve.

Enthusiastic and energised about data, working as part of a team you will extract particularly powerful empirical insights from internal and external data, creating robust metrics using a variety of tools and techniques (e.g. SQL & SAS), presenting results via strong visualisations to hundreds of users (in tools such as MicroStrategy). This could include scenario planning tools to help the business make faster and better decisions.
You will need some experience in joining the right data together in such a way that with a dashboard built over the top, business questions can be answered. You will lead projects with senior level stakeholders in our business, ensuring that the dashboards are embedded and insights being drawn from them are truly driving value into our business. The role is core to the development of dashboards and reporting across the Joint Venture including the Executive Team scorecard.

Key Responsibilities

Build a deep understanding of the business issues to be solved and frame the ‘right’ questions to be addressed.
Be able to work on own initiative to identify appropriate analytical solution(s) to a range of business challenges, with support from senior members of the team as required
Some experience in turning data into visualisations that are easy to navigate and provide the right level of detail for different roles in the business
Have good interpersonal skills to build effective business relationships
Present clear recommendations and action plans and measure outcomes.
Work closely with IT and our Accelerate O2 transformation programme to leverage requirements for data, access and toolsets

Skills & experience

Passionate about data and analytics and the value that can be created through information exploitation
Numerate and technically strong, using some or all of SQL / SAS / and willing to learn others. Some experience of Visualisation methods / tools is essential e.g. Microstrategy
Good presentation skills and an ability to talk to people at all levels of the business and make the complex, simple
Ability to work simultaneously across a number of projects, managing your own time and projects to deliver results

Key Stakeholders

Senior members of the BI&Measurement team and wider DI&A and equivalent teams within Virgin Media
Business stakeholders across Marketing, Sales, Operations/Networks and Finance – typically WLT and below
IT / BI – typically WLT and below

We’ll be sending you emails about the status of your application. To make sure you receive these, please add @O2.com and @telefonica.com to your Safe Senders list.
We’re looking to pay a great compensation package (depending on experience) for this position. We also offer plenty of extras to sweeten the deal, which could include things like bonuses, life assurance cover, health care and lots of flexible benefits.
Also, every employee has their personal development supported with a LinkedIn learning account; plus other role specific learning available through our award-winning digital learning platform - O2 Campus.
We also believe a great work-life balance is important, so we’re open to considering flexible working arrangements. Like to know more, feel free to raise it.
Join us and we’ll encourage you to be bold every day. So take a deep breath, your career is about to go to exciting new places.
If you have any questions around the role then please email ResourceTUK@o2.com who will be happy to help.

Want to do the best work of your life? With 24 million customers in 6 countries, make your mark at Europe’s leading media and entertainment brand. A workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work.
As part of our journey to becoming Europe’s most effective advertiser we are building a media strategy and testing department to sit within the Media Strategy and Performance team. The team will lead the development of best practice strategic guidelines for all markets based on the insight generated from a full range of advanced measurement tools and methodologies, including a new A/B testing capability. The new testing team will design, deploy and evaluate marketing tests, integrating results with econometrics and scaling via our strategic media “golden rules”. We are looking for a Media Testing Lead to take a pivotal role in establishing and running the testing programme as part of the newly created team.
What you'll do:
Support the Head of Media Strategy in driving media efficiency across the Sky portfolio, working closely with senior partners to establish the testing programme
Identify and prioritise in-campaign testing opportunities, identifying tests that challenge current marketing approach and improve media and creative efficiency across ATL and digital channels
Work closely with the Measurement Lead to design tests which ensure rigour and significance in results, including application of sophisticated Matched Market testing methodologies
Support team with analysing test results using sales and brand KPIs, and developing value-driving insights
Provide media testing expertise to teams across the Sky group by developing and sharing best practice including important metric selection and in-channel set up
Lead systematic integration and scaling of test learnings across media campaigns alongside Sky’s media planning team, marketing teams and external agencies
Manage Media Analyst and Scaling Manager responsible for the design and widespread adoption of tests and associated insights
Manage testing budget and costs working closely with media planning team, marketing teams, finance team and external agencies
What you'll bring:
Media expert with in-house media team or media agency experience; with experience leading a team
Self-starter with track record of driving transformations across organisations
Confidence in handling and influencing senior partners and c-suite – strong presentation skills are key (written and verbal)
Good knowledge of digital and offline channels required
Data-driven and analytical, with experience in media testing, preferably AB or Matched Market methodologies
A commercial approach and experience of working with significant budgets
The Rewards:
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special, here are just a few:
Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
A generous pension package
Private healthcare
Discounted mobile and broadband
Access a wide range of exclusive Sky VIP rewards and experiences
How you'll work:
We know the world has changed, and we want to offer our employees the chance to collaborate at our unique office spaces, whilst enjoying the convenience of working from home.
We've adopted a hybrid working approach to give more flexibility on where and how we work. You'll find out more about what this means for this role during the recruitment process.
Osterley:
Our Osterley Campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Gunnersbury, Ealing Broadway and South Ealing tube stations. There’s also plenty of bike shelters and showers.
On campus, you’ll find 13 subsidised restaurants, cafes, and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon.
Inclusion:
We take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion: we’ve been recognised by The Times and Stonewall for this, and we’ve committed £30million to support the fight against racial injustice. We’ve also set ambitious targets for increasing ethnic diversity and representation throughout our organisation.
At Sky we don’t just look at your CV. We’re more focused on who you are and your potential. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we're happy to discuss flexible working.
And we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you.
Why wait?
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.
To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about.
Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.

Own the roadmap for strategic workforce planning, people analytics, and data
About Our Client
A Financial Services firm based in the City of London.
Job Description
A Group Head of People Analytics with the following accountabilities:

Strategically partner and proactively manage a complex stakeholder group of senior HR leaders, HRBPs, change and transformation programmes and other stakeholders to understand the business insights leaders need to make evidence-based decisions, including people trends, capability needs, employee listening and predictive analytics. Proactively approach those teams with opportunities, maturing the capability of stakeholders to use people data and insights to drive better decisions and improved outcomes for the business.
Act as a visualisation and data storytelling expert, creating well-structured insights, storyboards and reports to effectively communicate insights to senior leaders, highlighting the implications of the results and decisions that need to be made, influencing decisions and outcomes and measuring impact.
Ensure that the basics of good people analytics are in place, that data is accurate, relevant and timely, methods are appropriate to build trust and understanding in what we do, core analytics standard solutions are in place to answer critical business needs, and training is available that help optimise the delivery and impact of people data. Future proof the delivery of data and analytics outcomes by informing and working with the HR Transformation programme.
Develop an effective and insight driven approach to strategic workforce planning, modelling and forecasting, evolving it over time to ensure it consistently delivers as the organisation grows, partnering with key internal stakeholders, providing an action framework and supporting HR and business leaders to execute their plans and close capability gaps.
Leverage external networks and connections to continuously seek best practices and learning from outside of L&G that can benefit the organisation moving forwards. Serve as a subject matter expert, provide thought leadership and lead on how we embed advanced techniques to shape how the business makes decisions about our employees through qualitative and quantitative insights. This includes ensuring data privacy compliance and ethics standards are adhered to in order to develop a trust environment for people data.
Lead through influence across the HR function globally to develop capability towards our ambition of being a digital and analytics function.
Ensure KPIs and measures to provide insight are in line with our culture and policies for treating employees and customers fairly.
Take the lead in all matters with regard to the management of employees, ensuring that management discretion is used in a consistent manner and that the area follows the Group's policies and procedures including the Partnership Agreement to maximise business performance.

The Successful Applicant
A Group Head of People Analytics with the following qualification / skills / experience:

No specific qualifications required, however a degree/masters in Organisation Psychology, Organisational Behaviour, or technical domain such as Maths, Statistics, Econometrics is preferred
Strong previous experience at this level. Significant experience in people analytics, strategic workforce planning, HR strategy & transformation, senior HR or business role at innovative companies.
Experience of implementing strategic workforce planning and people analytics practices/functions in large complex organisations.
Experience using quantitative and qualitative analytical strategies, including employee listening and data science techniques, to identify workforce insight and measure the effectiveness of programs, interventions, and efforts for a large organisation.
Broad and deep technical understanding of different analytics, visualisation tools and metrics and experience in communicating them to a wide audience, interpreting results and influencing how to apply them.
Project management - has demonstrable experience of successfully delivering data and digital change initiatives.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and communicate at all levels of the organisation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with ability to adapt communication styles to suit the audience and messaging.
Demonstrated leadership presence, highly results focused and target driven with a proven ability to inspire and influence across all levels.
Experience of promoting and developing a high-performance culture, recruiting and leading high performing teams.
Entrepreneurial, able to challenge and provoke in order to build and transform.
Experience collaborating across multiple partner groups, communicating with diverse audiences, and balancing dynamic priorities.
Holistic thinking and ability to deal with ambiguity.

What's on Offer
A competitive salary and benefits package depending on skills / experience.

Job title: Climate Risk - Climate impact modelling - Associate / VP
Description:
As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.

The Climate Risk team at JPMorgan is developing a new strategic data platform to host climate risk data and analytics going forward. We are building a team to help drive this initiative forward. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing team and shape the direction of climate risk data at the firm.

The Climate Risk Data team is responsible for delivering on all aspects of data management. This includes working closely with a wide range of stakeholders such as business, vendor organizations, technology, data science, data consumers, governance and controls. The Climate Data team will plan data requirements and set up capabilities for appropriate data validation, monitoring, access control, reporting, and data quality control.

The Climate Risk Data team will be expected to ensure delivery of comprehensive data for user consumption, including for climate risk modelling and analytics, maintain data dictionaries and lineage, improve data quality and consistency, and support governance requirements.

A very strong track record of ownership and accountability will be key to the success of this role. The candidate should be able to demonstrate participating in a large-scale initiative with high impact. More specifically, the candidate should demonstrate having deployed relationship building skills, with a superior ability for execution; worked effectively within an agile environment; earned credibility by leading and persuading others, while positively influencing the outcome of team efforts.

Joining the team you will:
Help develop an in-house analytical and model-driven approach on climate risk scenarios for JPMorgan with an emphasis on quantifying climate change induced economic and 2nd order impacts
Develop internal climate (physical risk) scenarios and expand scenario variables to meet internal stakeholders' requirements
Enhance chronic physical risk modelling capabilities
Interrogate, assess and choose appropriate models from external parties, including vendors
Coordinate with central data and modelling teams to source required data, develop climate scenario models, and determine how to best integrate climate risk data into BAU risk models

Minimum Skills, Experience and Qualifications

We are looking for someone excited to join our organization. If you meet the minimum requirements below, you are encouraged to apply to be considered for this role.
3+ years of experience in Integrated Assessment Modelling (IAM) is a requirement
Good understanding of (macro-)economics is essential
Working knowledge of climate-related physical risks and the transmission channels within an economy
Strong academic background in in a highly quantitative discipline with a focus on optimization modelling
Excellent analytical skills and comfortable working large datasets; expertise in econometrics and other quantitative methods is highly desirable
Familiarity with climate scenarios, e.g. NGFS, IEA, IPCC SSP-RCPs, etc.
Demonstrated relationship building skills, with a superior ability to make things happen through the use of positive influence
Ability to work effectively and gain credibility and respect of others. Lead and persuade others while positively influencing the outcome of team efforts
Highly effective in narrating the analytical output to stakeholders, with an ability to convey information clearly, accurately and succinctly (both written and verbally)
Proficient with coding in various languages; Python/R/GAMS experience a plus
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Customer-focused mind-set
We offer

Derive job satisfaction from delivering on-time, good quality work for appreciative customers, both internal and external

We look forward to welcoming a new team member in our fast growing company!

Our Marketing team look after one of the largest media budgets in the UK, and in this role you will deliver fully integrated cross-category consumer media plans. You will plan and procure media at best cost in conjunction with our media agency, media partners and internal stakeholders, measuring the effectiveness of our media and deliver increases in ROI. You'll also ensure we get the best out of our media agency partner, and use your insight and knowledge of the UK media marketplace to identify how emerging platforms and innovation can help to deliver our objectives.
A Place To Be You

We want to create games that appeal to people from all walks of life and we need a rich and diverse blend of people to make that happen. We hire exclusively on talent and we want our employees to feel like they can bring their whole self to work every day.
How you'll make a difference
Lead and champion the relationship with our Media Agency Partner (team c45 people) to ensure our media planning and buying are all best in class and media procured at best cost
Management and optimisation of the Media Budget to deliver our Annual Business Plan objectives including short term activation plans including late bought media for rollovers and longer term plans in line with AB deadlines to optimise cost and value
Continually optimise our media mix based on target audiences, evolving media consumption patterns and costs for the different objectives we have in our Media strategy
Use econometrics findings to drive ‘test & learn’ programs to prove / disprove media strategies and to improve ROI / effectiveness across our media mix
Accountability for the quality and cost of all media plans and securing sign off from the CMO and Head of Marketing Strategy & Activation
Driving media effectiveness and efficiencies on a Top 20 UK media budget by continually optimising our plans
Create effective processes to deliver all media placements to ensure integrity is maintained at all times
Identify and build strong relationships with key senior executives at Media Owners to identify and convert key opportunities for The National Lottery Brand
Integration with Led the integration of Media strategy / planning with other key business areas (e.g.Creative, Digital & Media channels, to help build best in class marketing plans – as part of the Integrated Campaign Development Process
Running Quarterly Media Audits (using external independent partners) to evaluate how well our media is being bought (quality and cost) versus a pool of the UK’s leading advertisers and implementing clear actions to continually improve our quality and cost
Monitoring of the media marketplace, costs of different media channels, media consumptions patterns and developments in digital platforms, media channel ownership to enable us to have the optimal media strategy in place to reach our target audiences at best cost
What you'll bring to the table

Detailed knowledge of the UK media marketplace and media consumptions trends
Track record of developing integrated media plans for a high profile media brand and significant media budget (£100m +)
Experience of managing media for an always-on-brand (rather than brand bursts)
Experience of managing a large Media Agency Partner and building direct relationships with senior people (Exec level) at Media Partners
Knowledge of category and brand marketing principles
Track record of successful project management skills
Experience of delivering returns on media investment (ROI)
Experience of Top 20 UK Media Budget Management, reconciliation and payment processes
What we’ll give you

We look after our people. There’s a competitive bonus and benefits scheme, 26 days of annual leave and a rather generous pension scheme. Thinking about your health? No probs - we’ll give you full private medical cover, access to dental schemes, eye care rebates, your annual flu shot, 50% off your annual gym membership, we’ll even give you access to remote health and wellbeing support - including access to a free digital GP and virtual counselling. We’ll give you all of the kit and tools needed to succeed.
We take your development very seriously. We encourage you to treat every day as a learning day, we offer a series of AMAZING Learning Events throughout the year and you’ll have access to the Camelot Playbook from day one - a guide to help you be your best.
Why work at Camelot?
Camelot is the home of The National Lottery. For 2020/21, we achieved record National Lottery sales of over £8 billion through our retail and digital channels, and we accomplished this with a workforce of just over 1,000 people - meaning every one of us has a part to play in making a difference.
Camelot’s mission is to change lives for the better - both the lives of National Lottery winners and the lives of the millions of people who benefit from the £36 million in Good Causes funding that is raised weekly by National Lottery players.
On top of this, we placed #10 in the Top 100 Large Companies list at the 2021 Best Companies Awards, as well as ranking as the #1 Large Company in London.
National-lottery.co.uk is one of the UK’s leading e-commerce sites - this is measured by web traffic - and we have more than 9.7million active registered players. We also operate four of the UK’s biggest FMCG brands including the iconic Lotto and EuroMillions.

Job title: Public Affairs - Research & Evaluation - Associate Director (Quantitative)
Description:
Are you looking to build your career in one of the world’s largest research Organisations?

The Government and Society Evaluation team is at the heart of Ipsos’s Public Affairs policy offering. It covers one of the most innovative and fast-moving policy areas within the UK and internationally. We apply impact evaluation and economic valuation techniques across a range of important policy areas. The focus of this role is on helping government departments decide how to make the most of its budget for supporting intangible assets like culture, heritage, sports energy, the natural environment and productivity related to information technology. We are looking for an Associate Director with substantial research and evaluation experience to join us and support our continued growth in these key areas.

The role…
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced evaluation researcher to lead important studies which influence and inform communications and decision-making, and helping to develop key client accounts and grow our business.

We are interested in a Researcher with quantitative research skills and evaluation focus, with experience in evaluation and managing client accounts. Economic valuation and mixed methods experience is desirable but not essential.

The main responsibilities will include:
Taking responsibility and accountability for overall delivery and quality of evaluation projects from start to finish.
Leading smaller projects or managing large and complex projects, across different methodologies, including process evaluation, impact evaluation (with consideration of counterfactual), and cost-benefit analysis.
Overseeing all aspects of the project lifecycle, from inception to design of questionnaires and sample strategies, to leading analysis plans to deliver final data and reporting outputs.
Signing-off deliverables (questionnaires, presentations and reports) which meet clients’ and stakeholders’ objectives, adopting creative approaches where relevant.
Assisting with proposals.
Developing a strong understanding of our clients’ needs and seeking opportunities to grow our business by taking a proactive approach to developing knowledge of the client’s needs.
Communicating effectively with clients, internal and external suppliers, and internal colleagues both in writing and verbally.
Supporting and supervising newer team members to deliver work and develop their own communication style whilst ensuring professionalism and outcomes which are in client and Ipsos’ long-term interests.
Effectively managing relationships with suppliers and internal operations colleagues to ensure the objectives of the research are met on time and to budget.
Thought leadership alongside Dr Lawton, a leading researcher in cultural capital, demonstrating how the application of evaluation methods and economic valuation techniques can inform policy decisions and feed into national accounts.
Generating innovative solutions: drawing on novel approaches from micro-economics, experimental and quasi-experimental econometric analysis, data science, and big datasets.
Contributing to the successful working of the Government and Society team and its positive, supportive environment where people are encouraged to challenge themselves to develop their skills.

What do I need to bring with me?

This role will suit candidates who enjoy working closely with clients, often delivering at a fast pace. We welcome interest from people with either a quantitative and/or economics background.
We are looking for someone with:
Desire to work closely with clients to maintain and grow our contracts.
Excellent quantitative research skills: able to lead multiple evaluation projects and support newer members of the team to develop their research and project management skills.
Ability to work to tight deadlines to deliver profitable work and assure quality of all outputs.
Ability to lead development of high quality research materials which answer client objectives.
Ability to understand and interpret complex data to draw out a clear narrative and insight to inform client decision making.
Excellent client handling and supplier negotiation skills.
Experience writing winning proposals including drafting costs.
Confident and clear written and verbal communication skills, including experience of preparing presentations (and ideally written reports) with a high level of accurate use of English.
We are happy and willing to support candidates to develop their knowledge of our clients’ policy areas so experience of this is not a prerequisite for applying.

About us ...

Ipsos is one of the world’s largest market research companies with offices in 90 countries. We are an innovative, entrepreneurial, client-focused organisation, providing research services to over 5,000 clients worldwide. Proudly, we are the only global market research company that is still controlled and operated by market researchers. We aim to be intellectually curious and passionate researchers who set ourselves high standards and aim to work collaboratively to service our clients most effectively.

Our culture is unique - we have the entrepreneurial spirit and quirkiness of a small boutique, but we also have the resources, scale and diversity of a large global agency. We have more bright, friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic people, from more backgrounds, with more interests, skills and experiences to learn from. Our values are based on our diverse cultural backgrounds, helping us to be responsive, client-focused and flexible.

We are committed to equality, treating people fairly, promoting a positive and inclusive working environment and ensuring we have diversity of people and views. We recognise that this is important for our business success - a more diverse workforce will enable us to better reflect and understand the world we research and ultimately deliver better research and insight to our clients. We understand the importance of choice and offer a blended work environment, office and work from home. We also realise you may have commitments outside of work and will consider all flexible working applications - please highlight what you are looking for when you make your application.

If this is what you are looking for from your next role, we look forward to hearing from you!

This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Join us as a Credit Stress Testing Analytics Manager
Take on a pivotal role in our Finance function, in which you’ll be modelling credit projections for stress testing, capital planning and strategy setting purposes
You’ll enjoy extensive visibility at a senior level within the bank and with executives and regulators
It’s an opportunity to further your career by working with senior stakeholders and enhance your technical skills and knowledge of the business in a fast paced environment
What you'll do
We’ll look to you to model credit risk scenario projections for a specific business area using the approved models and processes, ensuring a high standard of accuracy and adherence to controls in line with given regulatory time scales. You’ll be providing comprehensive supporting analysis and MI to explain scenario projections in the context of the given scenario, other inputs, models, methodology and assumptions, while engaging with stakeholders and experts from the business areas, Risk, Audit, and other functions to provide business insights and analysis in a timely manner.
Other key aspects of your role will involve:
Developing the quantitative models needed to project impairments and credit risk weighted assets, implementing the approved models or analytics solutions
Developing adjustments to modelled outputs to address model weaknesses and limitations or apply management judgement
Preparing detailed, high quality presentation materials for review and challenge purposes, and presenting modelling results to stakeholders
Producing ad hoc insights or analysis, as needed by the business or regulators, to help interpret and use stress testing results and scenario projections
Providing accurate evidence and documentation to help complete controls for the credit risk scenario projections process on time
The skills you'll need
To join us in this role, you’ll need knowledge of credit or financial modelling, with strong technical and communication skills. We’ll also look for you to have significant experience of credit risk analysis in a retail or wholesale banking environment, and a thorough understanding of stress testing requirements and the process, models, methodology and controls for generating credit scenario projections.
You should also hold a degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics or Economics preferably to PhD or post graduate level or with additional professional qualifications, such as a CFA or FRM.
As well as this, you’ll demonstrate:
Strong data handling and analysis skills, including programming languages such as SQL and Python or similar
An excellent understanding of the relevant capital requirements regulations and IFRS 9
An organised approach with the ability to manage projects and work effectively to deadlines
Excellent attention to detail
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help.

Introduction
The Economist Intelligence Unit, (EIU) is a world leader in global business intelligence. We help businesses, the financial sector and governments to understand how the world is changing and how that creates opportunities to be seized and risks to be managed.

Delivering market leading analysis and insight is in our DNA. At our heart is a 50 year forecast of the majority of the world’s economies. We seek to analyse the future and deliver that insight through multiple channels, allowing our clients to take better trading, investment and policy decisions.

The role

This is an exciting time to be joining Economist Intelligence. We need an interim expert to help us shape the future technology that supports the heart of EIU, our forecasting and economic modelling tools and systems. Our current structures work, but they are legacy and constrain our ability to innovate new business models and improve the existing product sets.

Reporting to the Group VP of Engineering and the EIU Chief Digital Officer, you will be an integral part of our move to cloud native infrastructure for this part of our business, and how we integrate data science, machine learning and other techniques into our core and award-winning econometric expertise.

You will be responsible for defining the data roadmap and architecture design for the EIU’s forecasting platform as well as enabling the existing data engineering and econometric teams to grow their capabilities in modern data technologies, driving best practices and functional excellence.
You will work closely with the Chief Economist, Head of Financial Risk, Head of Economics Unit and Head of Data Engineering to enable us to define and build this new platform capability.
You will have the opportunity to set the technical direction and to make your mark on a global brand's forecasting platform and we’re looking for someone who has not only done this before but is excited to join us and do it again.
Accountabilities
Specific Responsibilities
Define the architecture and roadmap (including governing the best-practices) for a new forecasting system or tools for Economist Intelligence
Delivery of a technical forecasting platform roadmap, partnering with key stakeholders and covering all forecast and data lifecycle stages (sourcing, enhancing, persisting and using data), environments, and development operations
Work collaboratively with our forecast experts, technology delivery leaders and domain architecture specialists to define, implement and deliver a driven forecasting strategy. Ensure this is delivered against P&L goals.
Contribute to the communication and adherence of data modelling and engineering guardrails and playbook with the data engineering teams
Ensure our forecasting platform and ecosystem will support our technology led objectives pertaining to: performance, availability, security, velocity, quality and cost optimisation

Attributes Required for the Role
Results Oriented
Motivation to perform and succeed
High-energy, robust and resilient
Analytical and driven by insight and understanding
Able to motivate, influence and empower others within a multidisciplinary and multi-geography team
Collaborative, supportive, hands-on as required and direct and open in approach (no architecture ivory towers)
Agile mentality - to achieve high-quality iterative delivery (including deployment automation) as we evolve along the roadmap
Experience, skills and professional attributes
Experience
Has created and grown an in-house data science capability - it would be a strong advantage if that experience were forecasting or time series related
Experience in data platform technology through all data lifecycle stages covering: sourcing, enhancing, persisting and using data
Has defined and delivered a data technology roadmap to achieve the strategic goals of a forecasting organisation
Has worked effectively in a global, matrix environment and demonstrated experience in satisfying internal customers for their data needs
Has worked effectively in a global data team with a delivery team located in a different geographical location
Has worked effectively in an agile, sprint-based delivery model
Has automated deployment of data platform technology changes in a cloud-based environment
Can assess and conduct a cost-benefit examination of various technologies related to this field and ability to assess new ones coming into the market
In-depth domain experience building high-performing data architectures in the following domains:
Forecasting and time series data
Data Governance
Data Platform
ETL Tools

Key Internal Relationships
Chief Digital Officer (UK Based)
Chief Economist (Singapore Based)
VP of Engineering (UK Based)
Economist Intelligence MD (UK Based)
Chief Technology Officer (UK Based)
Head of Data Engineering (Gurgaon Based)
Head of Financial Risk (UK Based)
Director of Economics Unit (Gurgaon Based)
Head of Architecture (UK Based)

The Position
The Sales & Marketing Manager for France will handle overall responsibility for promotional and marketing plans in order to deliver sales, and will represent the software and training throughout within France.
Key Responsibilities
Work alongside and manage team to develop 12 month promotional plans and communicate with all softwares and International offices
Organise demos with customers, prospecting to potential accounts and promotional plans
Strive to improve the software and training positioning and elevate the company brand
Management of the Sales and Marketing of new Software releases – Bi Annual

About the job
Job summary
Our Mission
At BEIS, we are leading the UK’s recovery from coronavirus and are building a stronger, greener country. Our varied work makes a real difference to people across the UK and internationally. This is a fantastic opportunity to become part of the BEIS team and our exciting mission!
We lead on the UK’s commitments to tackle climate change and drive green economic growth. We support businesses to create jobs and increase opportunity in regions across the UK. We also encourage investment and innovation to make the UK a science superpower producing research that will improve lives.
Our Inclusive Environment
We are building an inclusive culture to make BEIS a brilliant place to work where our people feel valued, have a voice and can be their authentic selves. We value difference and diversity, not only because we believe it is the right thing to do, but because it will help us be more innovative and make better decisions.
We offer first-class flexible working benefits, excellent employee well-being support and a great pension. We are fortunate to have a range of excellent staff networks and are proud to be a Disability Confident Leader employer. We will support talented people from all backgrounds to build a career and thrive.
We actively welcome applications from anyone who shares our commitment to inclusion. We will fully support candidates with a disability or long-term condition who require adjustments in our recruitment process.
Job description
This is an exciting time to join the Department for Business Energy and Industrial Strategy as we deliver the Government’s Plan for Growth. The Consumer and Competition Policy (CCP) Directorate is at the heart of this agenda. What we do affects businesses, consumers and the overall economy. Getting it right is therefore critically important and we pride ourselves on the quality of our advice and our project delivery.

CCP is a great place to work – people are enabled and supported to perform to their best and the culture is energetic, collaborative, kind and inclusive with excellent flexible working.

The Analysis, Corporate Support and Digital Markets (ACDM) team leads analysis for the Directorate and in addition leads policy development on: a) digital competition policy (new powers to regulate the largest tech firms with legislation expected in the coming year); and b) Smart Data policy (policy aimed at letting customers benefit from their own data more); as well as corporate support services for the directorate.

The Analysis Team works with policy teams to provide high-quality and insightful analysis to support competition policy, consumer policy and subsidy control. Analysis supports all stages of policy development from early problem identification to policy evaluation.
Person specification
The review and reform of all Retained EU Law (REUL) is a key priority for the Prime Minister and Cabinet. The ambition is to reinstate the supremacy of UK law and seize the regulatory and economic opportunities of EU Exit. This is a considerable challenge; over 2,400 pieces of Retained EU Law will be reviewed before deciding whether they should be repealed, reformed, sunset or preserved at the end of 2023. This includes key pieces of consumer and competition law, for example:

Consumer Protection Regulations 2008 and Consumer Contracts Regulations 2013 which together provide fundamental rights, for example against misleading information and aggressive sales practices and regarding online purchases.
Package Travel Regulations which provide protections for those booking holiday packages at home and abroad, including in the case of insolvency for the organiser.

Rules on timeshares, crystal glass, textiles and footwear. Of which the latter three must be retained in NI under the Protocol.

Competition block exemptions which exempt certain agreements from competition law prohibitions, providing greater certainty for businesses.

We are looking to recruit two G7 analysts to the Analysis Team to support this priority in Consumer and Competition Policy.

The post holders will be responsible for:

Line and/or task management of the 4+ junior economists within the team, setting direction and supporting their development

Identifying opportunities for research to build the evidence base; developing and leading research projects where valuable

Leading workstream planning for the analysis of consumer and competition related REUL to ensure analysis is delivered to time and to a high standard

Leading cost-benefit analysis in line with the Better Regulation framework and REUL guidance to support decision-making
Working collaboratively with policy leads to ensure policy advice is evidence-based and founded on sound analysis

Promoting analysis and evidence-based policy making in CCP and contributing to the wider BEIS analytical community

Skills and Experience

Analytical skills – Experience of using analysis to support sound policy development. This includes developing cost-benefit analysis to appraise the impact of proposed policy measures. Experience of developing research specifications and procuring research is beneficial, but not essential.

Collaboration – Experience of collaborating with colleagues across professions and with different backgrounds to deliver shared outcomes.

Communication – Experience of communicating analysis to a non-technical audience.

Delivering at pace – Experience of effectively planning to deliver against tight timelines to a high quality.

Applicants should use their CV and personal statement to:

State which analytical profession they are a member of / wish to join

Provide information on their eligibility for the analytical profession, if they are not already a member (see eligibility criteria below)

Outline relevant experience, including any theoretical and / or practical background in economics

Demonstrate that they have good communication skills.
Technical skills
To be assessed:
Government Economic Service (GES): Application of economics knowledge Government Social Research (GSR): Technical skills, analysis & interpretation. Government Statistician Group (GSG): Presenting and disseminating data efficiently. Government Operational Research Service (GORS): Knowledge and application of Operational Research skills and techniques - Government Economic Service (GES): Application of economics knowledge Government Social Research (GSR): Technical skills, analysis & interpretation. Government Statistician Group (GSG): Presenting and disseminating data efficiently. Government Operational Research Service (GORS): Knowledge and application of Operational Research skills and techniques
GES – https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/ges-technical-framework-2022
GSR - https://www.gov.uk/guidance/the-government-social-research-competency-framework
GORS – http://www.operational-research.gov.uk/recruitment/competencies/
GSG – https://gss.civilservice.gov.uk/policy-store/competency-framework-for-the-government-statistician-group-gsg/
Qualifications
For social researchers a 2:1 in a relevant social science degree with a substantive research element, such as demography, economics, human geography, linguistics, or psychology. Alternatively a 2:2 in a non-social science degree plus a masters level social science degree, or work place experience and a degree equivalent (Certificate or Diploma), are also accepted.

For statisticians a 2:2 in a subject containing formal statistical training, such as statistics, mathematics, economics, sciences, business studies, psychology, geography.

For operational researchers a 2:1 in a numerate field, such as operational research, mathematics, physics, econometrics, engineering, or management science.

For economists a first or 2.1 honours bachelors degree (or international equivalent) with at least 50 per cent of economics in the two final years (or equivalent); or a Post Graduate Diploma (or equivalent) or a Masters degree in economics, including a substantial amount of taught macro and microeconomics. You must also demonstrate substantial proven competence in applied economics as a professional economist.

Want to do the best work of your life? With 24 million customers in 6 countries, make your mark at Europe’s leading media and entertainment brand. A workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work.
As part of our journey to becoming Europe’s most effective advertiser we are building a media strategy and testing department to sit within the Media Strategy and Performance team. The team will lead the development of best practice strategic guidelines for all markets based on the insight generated from a full range of advanced measurement tools and methodologies, including a new A/B testing capability. The new testing team will design, deploy and evaluate marketing tests, integrating results with econometrics and scaling via our strategic media “golden rules”. We are looking for a Media Testing Lead to take a pivotal role in establishing and running the testing programme as part of the newly created team.
What you'll do:
Support the Head of Media Strategy in driving media efficiency across the Sky portfolio, working closely with senior partners to establish the testing programme
Identify and prioritise in-campaign testing opportunities, identifying tests that challenge current marketing approach and improve media and creative efficiency across ATL and digital channels
Work closely with the Measurement Lead to design tests which ensure rigour and significance in results, including application of sophisticated Matched Market testing methodologies
Support team with analysing test results using sales and brand KPIs, and developing value-driving insights
Provide media testing expertise to teams across the Sky group by developing and sharing best practice including important metric selection and in-channel set up
Lead systematic integration and scaling of test learnings across media campaigns alongside Sky’s media planning team, marketing teams and external agencies
Manage Media Analyst and Scaling Manager responsible for the design and widespread adoption of tests and associated insights
Manage testing budget and costs working closely with media planning team, marketing teams, finance team and external agencies
What you'll bring:
Media expert with in-house media team or media agency experience; with experience leading a team
Self-starter with track record of driving transformations across organisations
Confidence in handling and influencing senior partners and c-suite – strong presentation skills are key (written and verbal)
Good knowledge of digital and offline channels required
Data-driven and analytical, with experience in media testing, preferably AB or Matched Market methodologies
A commercial approach and experience of working with significant budgets
The Rewards:
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special, here are just a few:
Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
A generous pension package
Private healthcare
Discounted mobile and broadband
Access a wide range of exclusive Sky VIP rewards and experiences
How you'll work:
We know the world has changed, and we want to offer our employees the chance to collaborate at our unique office spaces, whilst enjoying the convenience of working from home.
We've adopted a hybrid working approach to give more flexibility on where and how we work. You'll find out more about what this means for this role during the recruitment process.
Osterley:
Our Osterley Campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Gunnersbury, Ealing Broadway and South Ealing tube stations. There’s also plenty of bike shelters and showers.
On campus, you’ll find 13 subsidised restaurants, cafes, and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon.
Inclusion:
We take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion: we’ve been recognised by The Times and Stonewall for this, and we’ve committed £30million to support the fight against racial injustice. We’ve also set ambitious targets for increasing ethnic diversity and representation throughout our organisation.
At Sky we don’t just look at your CV. We’re more focused on who you are and your potential. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we're happy to discuss flexible working.
And we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you.
Why wait?
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.
To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about.

Associate Director Cost Assessment Economics with a global consultancy
cost assessment, benchmarking, economics, economic regulation
About Our Client
Global Consultancy
Job Description
I am currently recruiting for an Associate Director Cost Assessment with a global consultancy in London. You will be working on a range of projects in the water and energy sectors. Your work will focus on cost efficiency but you will also provide support more broadly to the Power & Utilities team on economic regulation and policy development.The firm's clients seek expert advice relating to cost bench marking and cost assessment more broadly (for example cost benefit analysis of major projects). Our approach to bench marking typically involves econometric models comparing costs across companies.There is no 'typical project'. You will need to apply a structured strategic approach to problem solving, drawing on established economic principles, while having the capacity to think creatively.The projects that you will advise on will be high profile and varied. In recent years we have advised nearly every water and energy network company on their price control reviews, been the lead advisor on several CMA appeals in both the water and gas distribution sectors, and advised on major transactions within the sectors.This a senior position that involves a combination of report drafting, engaging with clients, and delivering and/or interpreting econometric analysis. You will be expected to be involved in the management of projects and to take a lead in developing proposals and other business development activities.
The Successful Applicant
We are looking for someone with cost assessment experience and detailed knowledge of the regulatory framework of the water and energy sectors in the UK. You will have experience of managing medium size project teams, liaising with and presenting to clients/stakeholders and business development.A successful candidate would bring excellent report writing, Excel and PowerPoint skills.Ideally you will be highly skilled in quantitative economic analysis, with particular knowledge and experience of cost assessment and have good knowledge and experience of statistics and econometrics.You will be an independent thinker with the ability to identify problems and contribute to the development of solutions, helping us to remain at the cutting edge of innovative thinking in the sector

What's on Offer
£90,000 - £110,000 PA DOE plus car allowance, bonus and benefits

Job title: CBIA Marketing Effectiveness Analytics Analyst - Industrial Placement - Weybridge, UK – 2023
Description:
Job Description
Site Name: UK - Surrey - Weybridge
Posted Date: Dec 20 2022
Job Description
Hello. We’re Haleon. A new world-leading consumer healthcare company. Shaped by all of us. Together, we’re improving everyday health for millions of people. By growing and innovating our global portfolio of category-leading brands – including Sensodyne, Panadol, Advil, Voltaren, Theraflu, Otrivin, and Centrum – through a unique combination of deep human understanding and trusted science. What’s more, we’re achieving it in a company that we’re building together. In an environment that we’re co-creating. And a culture that’s uniquely ours. Care to join us. It isn’t a question.
Future Talent roles at Haleon offer the chance to change the way people see and manage their everyday health. That’s an incredible opportunity. An exciting challenge. And a huge responsibility. We’re always looking for ambitious individuals who are inspired by our purpose to deliver better everyday health, with humanity. And want to help us achieve this goal. Right now we’re looking for placement students in CBIA Marketing Effectiveness Analytics Analyst to join us to do career defining work.
A career in Marketing, CBIA where none of us stand still.
This role is within the Global CBIA Marketing Effectiveness & Innovation team. It has a global remit which requires not only the ability to effectively manage relationships with teams across different countries but also a good understanding of different data sources and market dynamics. Role will be to help to develop and support the scaling and roll-out of Haleon’s Always-On Marketing Mix Modelling capability, to drive sales growth through media effectiveness.

What will your individual contribution at Haleon be?
This role will support the execution of the AO MMM programme, by partnering with Haleon’s BU teams to ensure its successful launch & adoption. You will help facilitate the end-to-end process, from data discovery to results delivery, and support the BU teams in incorporating the AO MMM insights into their media & marketing planning. Key responsibilities will include some of the following:
Partner with BU CBIA, KC, Publicis and local data owners to expedite data discovery & collection for new BMCs added to AO MMM, as well as ongoing flow of data for established BMCs
Create a communication channel between the central AO MMM team & BUs, to accelerate collaboration, ensure visibility of AO MMM and help resolve any issues
Partner with the BUs during the scoping of new BMCs, to ensure business questions are answered and to drive engagement with the workstream
Support training of BU & Publicis teams on the delivery tools and support them in incorporating the tools into their WoW
Leverage the insights derived from modelling to support cross market and cross brand meta-analysis on media performance
To recognise your dedication, energy and effort, benefits include:
A salary of 22,500 annually
an annual bonus linked to performance
employee recognition through our global scheme which rewards exceptional achievements
On-the-job experience and formal and informal training and development, delivered through a mixture of coaching, mentoring and formal training programmes
Health and wellbeing programmes to take care of your physical and mental health
We’re the people changing the future of everyday health. So you will be someone who has:
Creative and problem-solving thinking
Strategic/big-picture thinking
Entrepreneurial and agile mindset
Strong prioritisation and analytical skills
Personal accountability
Business and consumer/customer knowledge and understanding
Adaptability and resilience in ambiguity
A desire to learn and have meaningful impact
Fast learner with the ability to hit the ground running
Strong oral and written communication capability
Good networking and relationship building skills
Curiosity with a willingness to ask questions and dig deeper to find insight
Comfortable working data, strong attention to detail
Ability to partner effectively with business teams as well as technical teams
enable you to perform in this future talent opportunity:
Education required: You will have completed a minimum of 2 years of a Business degree, but will not have graduated at the start of your placement. You may be expected to provide evidence from your university to show you will be an undergraduate student for the duration of the placement year and they are supportive of your placement.
Other requirements: If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
Some knowledge of MMM or econometrics
Some knowledge of advertising/media
Good level of Microsoft office skills - including Excel and Powerpoint
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.
We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.
We flex the way we work so we can be at our best, where possible, and with agreement between line manager, team and individuals. We acknowledge not all colleagues can flex locations depending on their roles and that we don’t have all the answers. Yet.
We invite you to apply as soon as possible. The way we see it, every day is an opportunity. And we are joined by new talent, every day. We accept ongoing applications and will close this vacancy once we have enough applications.
Assessment centre dates: assessment centres/interviews will commence from November onwards
Role start date: July 2023
Need help with your application?
Please email us at ww.earlytalentrecruitment@haleon.com and let us know how we can help you. Or email us your number and we’ll call you back. We’ll make all reasonable modifications to support you throughout the recruitment process and we’ll treat all information you give us in confidence. Please get in touch to help us process your application as soon as possible.
Care to join us. Find out what life at Haleon is really like www.haleon.com/careers/

At Haleon we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone. We're striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives. Job title: NERA Economic Consultant/ Senior Consultant Energy and Environment
Description:
Consultant/ Senior Consultant
Energy, Environment, Communications and Infrastructure
London

NERA Economic Consulting (www.nera.com) is a global firm of experts dedicated to applying economic, finance, and quantitative principles to complex business and legal challenges. For over 60 years, NERA’s economists have been creating strategies, studies, reports, expert testimony, and policy recommendations for government authorities and the world’s leading law firms and corporations. We bring academic rigour, objectivity, and real-world industry experience to bear on issues arising from competition, regulation, public policy, strategy, finance, and litigation. NERA’s clients value our ability to apply and communicate state-of-the-art approaches clearly and convincingly, our commitment to deliver unbiased findings, and our reputation for quality and independence. Our clients rely on the integrity and skills of our unparalleled team of economists and other experts backed by the resources and reliability of one of the world’s largest economic consultancies. With its main office in New York City, NERA serves clients from more than 25 offices across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific.
There is an immediate opening for a Consultant or Senior Consultant level hire into the Energy, Environment, Communications and Infrastructure (EECI) practice based in our London office.
Examples of the required work might involve the evaluation of energy policies; conducting econometric analyses to support utilities on price control reviews; performing financial modelling and cost of capital estimation; advising investors on the value and risk profile of assets in the energy and infrastructure industry; supporting competition investigations relevant to regulated infrastructure industries; the design of tariffs for access to natural monopoly infrastructure assets; advice on energy market reform and the liberalization of utility sectors in emerging markets; and the creation of expert reports in lawsuits and arbitration proceedings.
Responsibilities
Work on a range of projects related to energy policy, utility regulation, energy market design, and transactions and disputes in the energy, utility and infrastructure industries.
Take project management responsibility for delivery of a range of projects, including regulatory, advisory, and due diligence assignments, as well as expert engagements on arbitration and litigation matters.
Manage and conduct high-powered economic research across the energy, utility and infrastructure industries using sophisticated modelling techniques
Write research reports and prepare client presentations for senior staff and clients to help them make informed economic decisions
Influence project strategy, including the preparation and presentation of oral and written submissions
Collaborate with in-house experts and outside academics
Conduct activities related to management and business development; building rapport with clients and developing a clear and detailed understanding of the business and client expectations, scoping projects, writing proposals, managing projects to time and budget, and contributing to or writing papers, articles and books
The successful candidate will manage multiple projects concurrently
Manage and recruit staff
Travel likely, though limited at the moment due to the pandemic.
You will need
Candidates should hold a Master’s or PhD degree in Economics, Finance or a related discipline, with a strong academic record
At least 3 years of prior relevant experience with a strong background in an economic consulting, government or regulatory setting
Experience of writing consulting reports or expert reports for legal proceedings
A proactive, entrepreneurial attitude to developing contacts, relationships with clients and potential clients
English fluency is required; other languages are desirable.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, and to enjoy solving analytical and empirical problems and have exceptional creative, critical thinking and technical skills.
What we offer
Competitive salary, bonus and an extensive benefits package including defined contribution pension and health insurance
A comprehensive orientation programme
Skill enhancement training sessions including Project Management, Business Development, and technical skills
The support of Business Development and Marketing Managers responsible for providing tailored and strategic business development services to assist consultants in their development
You will get involved in a wide range of interesting and challenging projects
Become part of an international team with diverse backgrounds and expertise
Firm-sponsored social activities
To apply
Click on ‘Apply now’, submitting your CV, cover letter, writing sample and academic transcripts directly on this posting.

For more information about NERA, please visit our website (http://www.nera.com).

Introduction:

The Economist Intelligence Unit, (EIU) is a world leader in global business intelligence. We help businesses, the financial sector and governments to understand how the world is changing and how that creates opportunities to be seized and risks to be managed.

Delivering market leading analysis and insight is in our DNA. At our heart is a 50 year forecast of the majority of the world’s economies. We seek to analyse the future and deliver that insight through multiple channels, allowing our clients to take better trading, investment and policy decisions.

The role

This is an exciting time to be joining Economist Intelligence. We need an interim expert to help us shape the future technology that supports the heart of EIU, our forecasting and economic modelling tools and systems. Our current structures work, but they are legacy and constrain our ability to innovate new business models and improve the existing product sets.

Reporting to the Group VP of Engineering and the EIU Chief Digital Officer, you will be an integral part of our move to cloud native infrastructure for this part of our business, and how we integrate data science, machine learning and other techniques into our core and award-winning econometric expertise.

You will be responsible for defining the data roadmap and architecture design for the EIU’s forecasting platform as well as enabling the existing data engineering and econometric teams to grow their capabilities in modern data technologies, driving best practices and functional excellence.
You will work closely with the Chief Economist, Head of Financial Risk, Head of Economics Unit and Head of Data Engineering to enable us to define and build this new platform capability.
You will have the opportunity to set the technical direction and to make your mark on a global brand's forecasting platform and we’re looking for someone who has not only done this before but is excited to join us and do it again.
Accountabilities:
Specific Responsibilities
Define the architecture and roadmap (including governing the best-practices) for a new forecasting system or tools for Economist Intelligence
Delivery of a technical forecasting platform roadmap, partnering with key stakeholders and covering all forecast and data lifecycle stages (sourcing, enhancing, persisting and using data), environments, and development operations
Work collaboratively with our forecast experts, technology delivery leaders and domain architecture specialists to define, implement and deliver a driven forecasting strategy. Ensure this is delivered against P&L goals.
Contribute to the communication and adherence of data modelling and engineering guardrails and playbook with the data engineering teams
Ensure our forecasting platform and ecosystem will support our technology led objectives pertaining to: performance, availability, security, velocity, quality and cost optimisation

Attributes Required for the Role
Results Oriented
Motivation to perform and succeed
High-energy, robust and resilient
Analytical and driven by insight and understanding
Able to motivate, influence and empower others within a multidisciplinary and multi-geography team
Collaborative, supportive, hands-on as required and direct and open in approach (no architecture ivory towers)
Agile mentality - to achieve high-quality iterative delivery (including deployment automation) as we evolve along the roadmap
Experience, skills and professional attributes:
Experience
Has created and grown an in-house data science capability - it would be a strong advantage if that experience were forecasting or time series related
Experience in data platform technology through all data lifecycle stages covering: sourcing, enhancing, persisting and using data
Has defined and delivered a data technology roadmap to achieve the strategic goals of a forecasting organisation
Has worked effectively in a global, matrix environment and demonstrated experience in satisfying internal customers for their data needs
Has worked effectively in a global data team with a delivery team located in a different geographical location
Has worked effectively in an agile, sprint-based delivery model
Has automated deployment of data platform technology changes in a cloud-based environment
Can assess and conduct a cost-benefit examination of various technologies related to this field and ability to assess new ones coming into the market
In-depth domain experience building high-performing data architectures in the following domains:
Forecasting and time series data
Data Governance
Data Platform
ETL Tools
